scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Foster discusses finances, travels, personal problems, employment, friendship, and his papers the "Hedgehog" and "Pennant." He mentions the Native American Association and expresses disdain for Africa, Negroes, and northern agitators.

did.unittitle: George G. Foster to Rufus Wilmot 1835 Feb. 12

scopecontent.p: Concerns R. W. G.'s lack of money and poor spirits. Mentions plans to continue the Hedgehogin Utica.

did.unittitle: G. G. F. to R. W. G. 1835 Nov. 23

scopecontent.p: Reports on travels, and lack of friends, money, and employment. Desires to return to the South and join a newspaper.

did.unittitle: G. G. F. to R. W. G. 1841 May 12

scopecontent.p: Discusses nature of friendship. Reports on travels, jobs, and eventual success in securing own newspaper ( Pennant) in St. Louis. Mentions Native American Association and the Louisville Journal.
